intro: Sisymbrium minutiflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered mustard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and slender, branching stems. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Sisymbrium minutiflorum is an annual herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting pollinator populations.
